Such a well-written and fun game. Probably in my top 5, which is saying something. And it doesn't stop if you switch to another app or hit the home screen like the first one did, so that's really helpful. There was one inappropriate joke, but otherwise it's a universally enjoyable game! The hint system is fantastic, too; I love being able to get a little nudge without the whole solution being given away. I really wish more games did that!

Absolutely fantastic! I was a little worried at first with the quantity of items to click and the use of multiple characters to control but it works really well. As with the first game, this is effectively in lots of parts with each section containing a handful of locations. This makes everything manageable (though definitely not easy). The storyline is great and the game is large. I absolutely loved it!

A truly great sequel, improving upon the first game's story and characters to deliver an even better story. Beautiful graphics as always, and lovely music. Some puzzles are somewhat lacking in challenge and rely more on trial and error, but overall this is a fantastic game, totally worth its price.

Another fantastic game that was faithful to the previous 'Inner World', with a few interesting additions. It continued the character development of characters we met in the other game and added some new interesting characters too. Excellent as far as point and clicks go, and forgiving of moments where you don't quite understand what to do in that the help button is always there to support you. Wonderful story again, and I got a little sad when I completed the game. I cannot wait for your next game. There was only one issue, mostly on the part of my phone being a little old, but could be an optimisation issue; the game would occasionally crash when it hit a loading screen, which was rather frustrating at times. Apart from that, a well deserved 5 stars from me.

replyContent:
Hi, please excuse the problems.
There are a few options that might help:
- Start loading times on Samsung devices can take quite long, please be patient for ~1min
- Google Play Game Services must be installed
- No app-optimization-programm should be running
Update will also be available soon.
Let us know if it doesn't help: support@headupgames.com

content: I couldn't put it down! Great game!
Wonderful story. Great game.

This game could be an easy 5-star if it wouldn't be riddled by little, but sometimes game-breaking bugs. For instance, using hints will break the interaction of items with the environment. The only solution I found was to completely restart the game. Annoying, but manageable. More severe is another bug I just encountered, basically preventing me from progressing in the game. One of the red plugs for the ticket machine just disappeared. I don't even know why, but I don't see  any way to complete the game now. Incredibly frustrating. This game could be absolutely great, but is rather disappointing, because of technical issues.
replyContent:
Hi Lukas,
Thanks for your review. 
We're currently working on an update to fix the occuring problems. Stay tuned for an update.
Best,
Team Headup

content: This game is amazing. I actually replayed the prequel before starting this game up, and while it's not required to have played the first game before playing this one, I highly recommend it as it adds to the story. And what a story it is! Comparing this game to the last one, I felt like this one was longer, and the puzzles were definitely more complex. There is a terrific hint system, but I hated how often I had to use it (quite frequently, as compared to one time during the entire prequel). Some of the puzzles were also a bit monotonous (like the pillar one). I also noticed some glitches. The game force closed several times (suddenly closing to the home screen with no warning). And during the final cutscene the game decided to go into a weird sort of portrait mode right when Libretta hugged Laura, and stayed in portrait until just before the credits rolled, which rather ruined the ending for me (I didn't move my tablet at all, so have no idea why the game tried to force itself into portrait mode). I also noticed a handful of errors in the subtitles (several misspelled words and one case of an extra word being inserted). All these things make me think the game should probably still be in beta. BUT - it's still a truly terrific game, and one I'm glad to have played. I'll probably return to play it again someday - and as someone who rarely finishes games even once, that says a lot. Definitely worth downloading. I just hope the issues are fixed before I do another playthrough.
replyContent:
Hi Brooke, thank you very much for your detailed review. Great to hear you enjoyed the game.
We'll have a look at the issues you had and try to fix them in an update as soon as possible.
